front: What does the line-height property control?
back: It controls the vertical space between lines of text. Accepted values include normal, numbers, percentages, and length units like em.

front: What is the list-style-type property used for?
back: It specifies the marker type for a list item, such as disc, circle, or decimal.
It sets the position of the list marker, with possible values of inside or outside.
It sets an image as the marker for list items using the url() function.

front: How can margin-bottom improve list readability?
back: It adds space below each list item, improving separation and readability. Example: margin-bottom: 10px;

front: What is a pseudo-class in CSS?
back: A keyword added to a selector to style an element based on its state, such as :hover or :focus.
It styles links that have not yet been visited by the user.
It styles links that the user has already visited.
It styles an element when the user hovers over it.
It styles elements like input fields or selects when they gain focus (clicked or tabbed).
It styles an element while it is being activated (e.g., clicked).
It makes the background image cover the entire element.
It scales the background image to fit entirely within the element.
It repeats the background image both horizontally and vertically.
It prevents the background image from repeating.
It sets the position of the background image using values like top, center, left, or percentages.
The background scrolls along with the page content (default behavior).
The background image stays fixed in place when scrolling.
It accepts url(), linear-gradient(), or radial-gradient() values to set background images.

front: What is the background shorthand property?
back: It allows you to set multiple background properties at once. Example: background: no-repeat url('img.jpg');

front: Why is contrast important for background and foreground colors?
back: Good contrast ensures readability. WCAG recommends 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.

front: What does border-top: 3px solid blue do?
back: It adds a 3px solid blue border to the top of the element.

front: What does border-right: 2px solid red do?
back: It adds a 2px solid red border to the right of the element.

front: What does border-bottom: 1px dashed green do?
back: It adds a 1px dashed green border to the bottom of the element.

front: What does border-left: 4px dotted orange do?
back: It adds a 4px dotted orange border to the left of the element.

front: What is the border shorthand property?
back: It sets width, style, and color for all four sides. Example: border: 1px solid black;
It creates rounded corners on an elementâ€™s border.
It sets the border style. Accepted values include solid, dashed, dotted, and double.

front: What does linear-gradient() do in CSS?
back: It creates a gradient that transitions between colors in a straight line.

front: What does radial-gradient() do in CSS?
back: It creates a circular or elliptical gradient that radiates from a central point.
